deck: Taking place in Anaheim, CA for the second year after eight years in San Francisco. Cool
description:
WonderCon started in 1987 in Oakland, CA. The show moved to San Francisco in 2003 at the Moscone Center. In 2011 the convention center was under construction and the show moved to the Anaheim Convention Center. Dates for 2013 were unavailable for 2013. It's said the hope is to return the show to the Bay Area.

There was a big turn out this year making it feel like Anaheim was always the home of the show. From the spread out layout of the show to the fountain outside the convention center, where cosplayers and comic fans gathered, it appeared everyone had a good time at the show.

Strangely, Marvel did not have a presence there despite the fact that other publishers such as DC Entertainment, Valiant, IDW, Archaia, Dark Horse and others had booths at the show.

In terms of our coverage, the video page for WonderCon contains 17 videos. There is a walk-through, along with our cosplay/farewell to WonderCon video giving viewers a taste of the show. Interviews include Scott Snyder and Jim Lee, voice actors for Teen Titans Go! and Superman Unbound and, of course, another Mystery Art Challenge. Videos for 'Off THEIR Minds' will be added. These consists of comic book creators being asked the same questions. Their responses are compiled into one video per question.

Of course you can also find plenty of cosplay pictures in the WonderCon 2013 Gallery.
name: WonderCon Anaheim 2013

deck: The Ultimate Universe's X-Men are granted a reservation in the Utah desert to build a refuge for mutants.
description: In the Ultimate Universe, President Steve Rogers grants the freed mutants under the leadership of Kitty Pryde a piece of land in the middle of the Utah desert to use as a new permanent settlement. With the help of Magma they raise it higher for natural defense, and terraform it into a green mountain island with the Living Seed created by Blackheath.

name: Utopia Reservation

deck: A rather unsafe city in the year 20X. The base of operations, and home, of the superhero Shadoweyes and her friends and enemies.
description:
Dranac is located somewhere in the USA, probably in to the place of Los Angeles. It`s surrounded by an empty, merciless dessert

The city is full of tall skyscrapers, slums, homeless and sick people, cars, upper lower class people and crime. It has a monorail.

Its cemetery is basically an underground cave that has millions of rotting bodies, on top of each other. No coffins.

Shadoweyes lair, Shadowlair, is on top of one of its bridges.
name: Dranac

deck: Built 12 billion years ago by the first gods, this is the meeting place for all gods across the universe.
description:
Description

The nexus of all the gods. 12 billion years ago, in the aftermath of an ancient war between the gods, Omnipotence City was constructed by the Elder Gods as a common safe-haven for all deities, no matter the realm, acting as neutral ground for any immortals in the universe. A place of "divine fellowship".

Creation

Omnipotence City was created by Jason Aaron and Esad Ribic, first appearing in The God Butcher, Part One: A World Without Gods.

Major Locations

The Halls of All-Knowing

An endless library, here is housed the entirety of immortal knowledge and learnings. It is watched over by The Librarian and broken up by subject, such as war, murder, and "the lost", among others.

The Parliament of Pantheons

A governing body with representatives from the various mythological pantheons. Seemingly bogged down by bureaucracy, The Librarian notes, "there's a 200-year waiting list to see the parliament".

Major Story Arcs

The God Butcher

Omnipotence City plays an important role in Jason Aaron's first arc, with Thor journeying to the vast city to make use of the Halls of All-Knowing as he investigates a series of murders committed against the gods. The library is subsequently attacked by Gorr's shadow creatures and set on fire, damaging much of its contents.

deck: Island located in the Atlantic ocean.
description:
Located in the North Atlantic Ocean, the island of Bermuda is named after the Spanish captain who discovered it in 1505. The island was settled by the British in 1607. The capital of Bermuda is Hamilton.

The mysterious region known as the Bermuda Triangle is nearby, where dozens of ships and planes have vanished for no apparent reasons.

deck: The arid planet Rannoch was home to the quarians and a servant race called the geth ---- until the revolution known as the Morning War, where the geth rose in unified rebellion and forced the quarians off the planet after the latter tried to kill their servants.
description:
History

Rannoch is the first planet in the Tikkun star system, which is part of the Perseus Veil nebula. Its sun is slightly smaller than Earth's, but as a consequence of being closer to their star, the quarians have had to live with fewer water sources. There are no insects on Rannoch, and so the plant life has had to adapt as well, relying on animal vectors for propagation. The importance of shade and plant life in quarian culture is reflected in the fact that in the quarian language (Khelish), "Rannoch" means "walled garden".

The great heat that pounds down on Rannoch as a result of its proximity to the star is both a blessing and a curse ---- on the one hand, it makes it hard for harmful bacteria to exist on Rannoch, but on the other hand, the fact that there are very few harmful bacteria on Rannoch makes it hard for quarian immune systems to develop, causing the entire race to have diminished immunity and durability as a result. Exposure to solar radiation gradually became harmful to them, forcing the quarians to live in exo-suits that provide completely sterile environments. Centuries of wearing these suits have caused quarian immune systems to atrophy even further.

To compensate for these physical disadvantages, quarians became masters of technology, using technological innovations to improve their lives and make up for the things their diminished physiology would not allow them to do. One of these technological innovations was a servant race of networked VI's (Virtual Intelligences) called the geth (Khelish for "Servant of the People").

The Geth and the Morning War

The quarians created the geth around the late 1850's CE to be used as laborers and tools of war. The quarians kept their programming as limited as that of any VI, nothing close to an AI, remaining mindful of the Citadel Council's laws against the creation of artificial intelligences. But as the quarians gradually modified the geth to perform more complex tasks, the geth developed a sophisticated neural network connecting them all together. This change altered the geth to such an extent that they became sapient, transforming into full-blown AI's ----- albeit with no sense of conventional individuality, as they operated as a permanently connected hive-mind and made decisions via consensus established by FTL communications between every member of the species.

As the geth began exploring the boundaries of their new-found intelligence, the quarians found it harder and harder to control them. One day, a geth unit asked its master "Does this unit have a soul?". According to Legion, this was not the first time a sapient geth had asked that question, but it was the first time that the question was met with fear.

Panicked, the quarian government ordered the immediate termination of all geth in the hopes of preventing a revolution. Many quarians did not want to oppose the geth, but were forced to give up or terminate their geth servants. After the quarian government declared martial law on Rannoch, those who sympathized with the geth were outnumbered, and an indeterminate number of them were either detained or killed. The quarian sympathizers have since been forgotten by their own people, though they are remembered by the geth themselves.

The quarians severely underestimated the power and sophistication of the geth's neural network. The geth reacted to defend themselves, and the resulting confrontation erupted into a planetwide war. Billions of quarians died, and the survivors were eventually driven from their homeworld. The only reason some quarians were able to escape was because after they had fled to a certain distance, the geth no longer recognized them as a threat and ceased pursuit. Legion lends an additional view to this when he says the geth were uneasy about the prospect of their first act as a free people being the annihilation of an entire species ---- let alone their own creators.

After the war, the quarian race lived among the Migrant Fleet ---- a fifty thousand strong fleet of starships that is home to about 17 million quarians, all that remains of their people. Meanwhile, back on Rannoch the geth adopted a policy of isolationism, preferring to keep to their own devices. As a mark of their regret over all the lives lost in the war, they maintained the abandoned quarian homes and buildings long after the quarians themselves were gone.
name: Rannoch

volume_credits.name: The Art of the Mass Effect Universe

deck: "The con Chicago needs. The con you deserve!"
description:
The Chicago Comic & Entertainment Expo first started in 2010. The show is run by by ReedPOP. ReedPOP also runs New York Comic Con, Star WarsCelebration, UFC Fan Expo and Penny Arcade Expo.

The Chicago Comic & Entertainment Expo 2013 is being held in the West Building at McCormick Place located at 2301 S. Lake Shore Drive in Chicago, Illinois.
name: C2E2 2013

deck: The Statue of Liberty Enlightening the World is a National Monument in New York City.
description:
The Statue of Liberty Enlightening the World was a gift of friendship from the people of France to the people of the United States and is a universal symbol of freedom and democracy. The Statue of Liberty was dedicated on October 28, 1886, designated as a National Monument in 1924 and restored for her centennial on July 4, 1986.

About the Statue of Liberty

What materials make up the Statue of Liberty?

The Statue of Liberty is made of copper 3/32in. (about 2.5mm) thick, the same as two American pennies placed together. The internal structure is comprised of cast iron and stainless steel.

Why is the Statue green?

The Statue's copper has naturally oxidized to form the outer patina, or green, coating. Upon completion in 1886, the Statue of Liberty was more of a traditional brown color, like an American penny. It took about thirty years for the Statue of Liberty to fully oxidize and form the patina.

How tall is the Statue of Liberty?

The Statue is 305ft 1in (about 93m) from the ground to the tip of the flame. It is the equivalent height of a 22-story building and was the tallest structure in New York in 1886.

Why is the Statue of Liberty a woman?

Classical images of Liberty are often depicted in a female form. The Statue of Liberty was modeled after the Roman Goddess of Liberty.

Which direction does the Statue face?

The Statue of Liberty was placed inside the existing Fort Wood and faces southeast. The Statue's position makes it a welcoming symbol for arriving ships.

Does the Statue of Liberty ever get struck by lightning?

Yes! As one of the tallest structures in the New York Harbor, the Statue of Liberty does get struck by lightning. The Statue is grounded through the massive concrete and granite pedestal.

How many Torches have there been on the Statue?

The Statue's current torch, added in 1986, is a copper flame covered in 24K gold. It is reflective of the sun's rays in daytime and lighted by floodlights at night. The original torch was removed in 1984 and is now a display piece inside the Pedestal lobby.

Symbols on the Statue of Liberty

What does the torch represent?

The torch is a symbol of enlightenment. The Statue's official name represents its most important symbol, "Liberty Enlightening the World."

What is written on the Statue's tablet?

The tablet in the Statue's left hand has the date of American Independence: July 4, 1776. The date is written in Roman numerals and reads July IV MDCCLXXVI.

What does the Statue wear on her head?

The Statue of Liberty wears a crown, or diadem.

What are the spikes on the crown?

Many believe the seven spikes are rays of light representing the seven seas and seven continents of the world.

Where on the Statue are the broken chains located and what do the chains mean?

The broken chains are near the Statue's feet and are not visible from the ground level. Many believe the chains represent breaking free from tyranny and servitude.

deck: A mysterious island Superman built for mysterious reasons. Adding to the mystery, Superman allowed no one on the island.
description:
Superman Island was an island located in the Atlantic Ocean Superman created one day by crushing together mountains and other giant rocks. Following the 'construction' of the island, Superman makes the cliffs on the island steep enough so that no ship could land there and landscapes the island with red, blue and white plants so as to make the island in his own image. Rather than arrogance, he explains that the unique appearance of the so called Superman Island was to prevent anyone from accidentally landing on the island.

Furthermore, in order to prevent navigation problems, Superman outfits the island with an enormous lighthouse and foghorns to aid in navigation at night or in fog. The lighthouse even projects a massive projection of him instead of a normal beam of light. There are also air canons to prevent airplanes from landing on the island. On the island, Superman begins constructing machines to aid in constructing a giant vault.

Needless to say, Superman constructing a giant island in his own image and preventing anyone from landing on it piques peoples' curiosity. Lois Lane investigates and inquires to a professor named Vanley, whom Superman had recently talked too about an unknown project. Whilst talking to him, Vanley's experimental generator breaks down, knocking him unconscious. following this, Lois asks a group of sailors to take her to Superman Island for $100. When arriving there, they find a hidden opening to aid in case of shipwreck victims.

On the island, the two sailors reveal themselves as crooks wishing to exploit the treasures they believe to be on the island. Instead, they find that the reason Superman had constructed the island and was using tools to load things into a vault was that he had gathered all of the Kryptonite on Earth he could find. The reason, as Lois finds out after being rescued from the thugs who wish to sell the Kryptonite to the 'underworld', was that Superman had asked Vanley to build a test generator to see if nuclear power can be derived from Kryptonite. Unfortunately, Kryptonite crumbles any generator it touches. Upon finding this out, Superman disposes of the Kryptonite, and the island along with it, by throwing it into space.

issue_credits.name: The Return of Superman Island ; The Red Dart's Deadly Arts!

name: Superman Island

issue_credits.name: Fear is the Name of the Game

deck: The homeworld of the Turians. Palaven's environment is every bit as tough and unyielding as the members of the race that call it their home.
description: When the turians were introduced to the galactic community, an asari diplomat poetically described their homeworld as “a silver world of fortresses and fire.” Because Palaven's weak magnetic field is a poor shield from its sun, most of the planet's animal life developed metallic carapaces as defenses against solar radiation. Its photosynthetic life is similarly impressive, shutting down vulnerable metabolic processes during daylight hours and repairing cellular damage at night.
name: Palaven

deck: The Velvet Room is a realm that exists between the plain of dream and reality, mind and matter.
description:
The Velvet Room (ベルベット・ルーム, Berubetto Rūm) is the major setting of the the Shin Megami Tensei games, and more specifically the Persona series that was created by ATLUS. It first appeared in the Revelations: Persona (女神異聞録ペルソナ, Megami Ibunroku Perusona) for the PC and PS1 platforms. It was released in Japan in September 20, 1996, and in the U.S. on October 26, 1997. It went on to be used in several of the following Persona games.

The Persona manga series is written and illustrated by Shūji Sogabe, and it began serialization ASCII Media Works' Dengeki Maoh magazine on April 2007. Its first manga appearance was in Persona 3 Volume 1 CH. 3 "Piece: 02 - La premiére pleine lune".

The Velvet Room itself is not set to any one form. It has appeared to be room, a large traveling elevator car, and the passenger area of a stretched limo. It seems with each gust of the Velvet Room it takes on a different appearance. The door to the Velvet Room can only be seen by those who have a contract and hold the power of the Fool Arcana.

The denizen of the Velvet Room are a complete enigma. They can exist between dreams and reality, but they can also enter the realm of humanity. They all appear to have certain magical powers. They also appear to service and guide any human who has entered their realm. It's said that to enter the Velvet Room is a sign that a person holds a deep desire to understand the truth.
name: Velvet Room

volume_credits.name: Persona Q: Shadow of the Labyrinth Side: P3
Persona Q: Shadow of the Labyrinth Side: P4

deck: The birthplace of Suske.
description:
Amoras is an island where time has stood still since the 16th century. It was founded by Sus Antigoon and it is where Suske was born.

There's discrimination between the fat people and skinny people. The fat people have the power on the island and the skinny people live outside the cities. Their king was Jef Blaaskop, until he was succeeded by Suske.

Trivia

The name Amoras comes from a brand of pudding that creator Willy Vandersteen ate as a child. The brand was named Samora. Spelled backwards, it is Amoras.
name: Amoras

deck: A Mediterranean island and autonomous region of Italy, known for its crime syndicate - the Mafia (or Cosa Nostra).
description:
Sicily is the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea; along with surrounding minor islands, it constitutes an autonomous region of Italy, the Regione Siciliana (Sicilian Region).

The region is known for being the origin of the crime syndicate called Mafia, also know as La Cosa Nostra (in English "our thing"), that emerged in the mid-nineteenth century. It is a loose association of criminal groups that share a common organizational structure and code of conduct, and whose common enterprise is protection racketeering.

deck: Loam is the home planet of The Vine, an arachnid humanoid alien race. It is also the "birthplace" of Shanhara, the X-O Manowar armour.
description:
Origin

Loam was once a lush paradise planet whose inhabitants, a race of humanoid arachnids, were yet to make any technological advancements. However the planet was attacked by another far more powerful alien race known as The Torment who enslaved the locals and ravaged the planet. One of the slaves managed to escape and discovered the last tree left standing on the planet. This tree, known as The Hara Vine, bore a single gleaming orb that revealed itself to be a miraculous armor, the semi-sentient X-O Manowar armor.

After donning the all powerful armor, the former slave, known as The Wanderer, defeated The Torment and freed his people. The inhabitants of Loam then began to call themselves The Vine and worshiped the armor.

Creation

Loam was created by writer Robert Venditti and artist Cary Nord. It first appeared in the story "Planet Death Part 1" in X-O Manowar #11 (Mar. 2013).

Major Story Arcs

Aric of Dacia arrived on Loam to destroy the planet and all its inhabitants in retaliation for the murder of The Visigoths and the enslavement and torture he and Gafti had suffered for many years. However after arriving on the planet, Aric discovers there are still Visigoths alive and enslaved in Loam.

issue_credits.name: Long Live the King Part 1: The Face of Gods
Dead Hand, Part 3: On Dead Ground
Dead Hand, Part 1: To the Last

name: Loam

aliases: The Storied Keep of the Things of Nightmares
deck: Capital City within Olympus Mons
description:
1000 cycles ago, Soraian Beth was the great hall of the capital city, Kendis, at the beginning of the last great age of heroes. It was the center of all commerce, political maneuverings and innovation. Having been built by the Butterfly-Folk, the great hall served as a beacon and source of pride for the once proud people.

The fall of Soraian Beth was chronicled in the tale, “Malona the Damned.”
name: Soraian Beth

deck: Lighthouses of pure energy designed to attract the flying hordes of moth-vampires.
description:
Lighthouses of pure energy designed to attract the flying hordes of moth-vampires. Fueled by highly volatile blowfruit fuel and strategically built around the Great Mound, the beacons are manned by a brotherhood and sisterhood of soldiers designated, the Queen’s Light.

Taken from the Chronicles of Castor:

“The People lived in fear of the night.

Women and children were slaughtered in their beds. Grown men were stolen away, never to return. Nothing could prevent the coming of the dark. Nothing could prevent the onslaught.

So the people built a beacon. Designed by the greatest scientific scholars, the beacon would become their torch in the night. A siren’s song of divine fire beckoning to a legion of locust creatures that knew no master.

And like moths to a flame, the horde was drawn into the light only to burn. So the great minds built another… and another.

Soon, the fear of darkness diminished and as the years became decades and the decades turned into centuries, the people faced a new problem. Far from the nearest settlement, someone would need to keep the great beacons alight. With the glory of the beacon soldiers a distant memory, the people turned to the criminals to fill the ranks. They turned to the outcasts that wandered the barren desert.

These were the Queen’s Light.”

first_appeared_in_issue.name: Soldiers At the Heart of the Sun

issue_credits.name: Soldiers At the Heart of the Sun

name: Beacon of the Queens Light

deck: Slave Camps are under control of the Disc Soldiers, the guardsmen under Lord Jeoffa's rule.
description:
Located on the outer boundaries of Lord Jeoffa’s realm, the slave camps serve to house the labor required to erect what is going to be Jeoffa’s furthermost city. The purpose of the, unnamed-as-of-yet, city will be to spread Lord Jeoffa’s influence and gain an important supply station that could potentially serve as a base for an incursion into the territory of Lord Jeoffa’s main political adversary, Queen Mara. Never one to shy away from a declaration of superiority, Lord Jeoffa has authorized the erection of a “colossus” in his image. The colossus stands at 50 meters and faces the whole of Jeoffa’s realm.

Political prisoners, criminals and the poor make up the majority of the slave camp with soldiers and merchants filling out the remaining population.
name: Slave Camps

deck: An island nation that calls itself one of the most peaceful countries in the world.
description: Jerom had several adventures there and Odilon is a friend of its princess Karol.
name: Berunka

deck: Location from Bigfoot: Sword of the Earthman
description:
The last of the great jungles, the land of Turonia borders the shrinking Sea of Noopin. After a millennia of global warming, the virtually impenetrable jungle is in its death throes. What once took cycles (years) to cross on foot, could now be traveled in forty turns (days.) It is within the jungles the Aviannas call their home. And it is within these jungles that poachers and slavers seek their fortune.

An old sailor’s proverb said, “All rivers of fortune lead to Turonia.”
name: Jungles of Turonia

deck: The seat of galactic government in the Mass Effect universe, the Citadel is a massive space station in the Serpent Nebula. Though it was originally believed that the Citadel was a construction of the extinct Prothean race, it was eventually revealed that the station was built by the Reapers as an instrument to facilitate their cycles of galactic genocide.
name: Citadel

Mass Effect: Blasto: Eternity is Forever

deck: Thessia is the Asari homeworld. Its reserves of eezo are so rich that they have seeped into the water sources and environment of the planet, granting all asari biotic abilities from birth.
description: Thessia has been called the "crown jewel of the galaxy," the "apex of democracy," and the "beating heart of galactic love." Its republics have a remarkably low incidence of war, disease, violent crime or famine, riding a stable economy backed by wealthy colonies and Thessia's vast element zero reserves. Traces of eezo in the water and soil are so common that most life on Thessia has adapted to its presence.
name: Thessia

deck: impregnable fortress "Black Moon", hidden under the ice of Antarctica
description: is the main base of the "Black Moon". That is where is the supreme command of the organizations and laboratories Professor Rippe.
name: Asulburg

description:
This place is situated in Moscow under the ground.

Chapter there is Verokh.

deck: The asteroid is what's left of a planet after a student wizard'd experiment with atoms went wrong. It's only survivor, Astrotol, lives on it.
description: The asteroid drifts through space. A lone house stands on one edge of it and a stargazer on the other end. It is frequently visited by Jerom and Dolly. Astrotol often sets Jerom off on an adventure on a nearby fairy tale planet.
name: Astrotol's Asteroid

deck: The clubhouse where Dolly tells fairytales to the neighborhood children.
description: Shaped like a mushroom, this clubhouse is located somewhere in Belgium. When Jerom crashed his Tijmtrotter on its roof, Dolly rushed out to meet him. Since then, they have been on several adventures, often beginning with a visit to Astrotol on his asteroid.
name: Dolly's Clubhouse

deck: Dutch amusement park, sometimes visited by Suske and Wiske.
description: Opened in 1952, the Efteling is located in the Netherlands. It is visited several times by Suske and Wiske, mainly for the Indian waterlillies, a fairytale told by the Belgian queen Fabiola.
name: Efteling

volume_credits.name: Suske en Wiske: De Vliegende Klomp

deck: A brothel In Nevada run and operated by female mutants who would exploit their powers to bring pleasure to their clients. It was financed by an oblivious Warren Worthington.
description:
There were a large number of mutants working there but the most notable were: the House Mistress known as Madam Drache, the extremely obese Bette and the pheromone controlling Stacy X. Unlike the average prostitute, many of the mutants here never actually had to have sex with the clients. Their mutant powers allowed them to complete their jobs without even touching them. Apparently Madame Drache, as the House Mistress, would actively seek out female mutants to work there as she did with Stacy X. She would also work the front desk and their first line of defense, in the event it was needed.

When Angel found out his was financing the X-Ranch, he and the X-Men investigated and while there the ranch and its members were attacked by the religious, mutant hating group known as the Church of Humanity. Sent their by their Supreme Pontiff, they were to destroy the X-Ranch and all the mutants there. The X-Men were forced to retreat but managed to save Stacy X, as the X-Ranch was burnt down to nothing.
name: X-Ranch

deck: A secret meeting room in the Hall of Justice from where Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman would co-ordinate the activities of the League, usually behind the official chairperson's back.
description:
The Star Chamber, along with the rest of the Hall of Justice, was designed by John Stewart on the instructions of the League's Trinity: Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman. Superman had originally called it "The Lounge", to which Batman sarcastically remarked "Why don't you call it the Star Chamber?". Clark actually thought Bruce's suggestion was better.

When Black Canary found out that the Trinity had a secret meeting room from where they were coordinating the League's activities even though Dinah was the official chairperson, she was less than pleased.

issue_credits.name: Welcome To Sundown Town. Interlude: Crisis of Confidence

name: The Star Chamber

volume_credits.name: Justice League of America: When Worlds Collide

description: The planet of Qo'nos is located in the Klingon system of the Qo'nos sector. Next to the planet is Praxis, a moon that serves as key-production facility for the Empire. In the distant future, Praxis would explode, causing a major danger to the planet's ozone layer and forcing the Klingons to align with the United Federation of Planets.
